children.html:
I was once a child with a dream looking up to the stars. Now I'm an adult in a spaceship [...] 
        looking down to our beautiful Earth. 
        To the next generation of dreamers: if we can do this, just imagine what you can do

This (totally spontaneous) speech was made by Richard Branson after he managed to fly a ship to (almost) space.
        It was just another small event in the billionaire space race / dick-measuring contest that has been happening 
        for a few years between Bezos, Musk and Branson. They have been publicly competing through ridiculous PR stunts 
        (such as Musk sending a Tesla into space), filling up mainstream media with discourses about space conquest, 
        heroic achievments, and their self presentation as pioneers of humanity.

My mission statement, which I wrote inside my spacesuit, is to turn the dream of space travel into a reality 
        - for my grandchildren, for your grandchildren, for everyone.

title: Richard Branson in Space : "To The Next Generation of Dreamers"
